title: How to Make a Homemade Devil Dog (Drake's Cake Bar)

steps.headline: Place the eggs needed into a medium-sized bowl along with the shortening and sugar.
Beat this mixture with a blender.
Combine into this mixture the milk and vanilla needed, but don't stop blending while doing so.
Combine in another bowl the flour, cocoa, salt and baking powder.
Blend this mixture until smooth and creamy.
Spoon about 1 Tbsp.
steps.description: of batter into strips measuring approximately 4 inches (10.2 cm) long by 1 inch (2.5 cm) wide onto a cookie sheet. The original recipe states to use a lightly greased cookie sheet, however, you may find it producing better results if you use a sheet of waxed/parchment paper instead (to enrich the color), but be sure to adjust the cook times to compensate for this change.

steps.headline: Bake these strips for 5-6 minutes or until they are done.
steps.description: Prepare the filling as these strips are baking.

steps.headline: Combine all ingredients used to prepare the filling in another bowl.
steps.description: This includes the marshmallow cream filling, shortening, sugar, vanilla, salt and water.

steps.headline: Take out your Devil Dog "buns"/"Cakes" from the oven.
Allow these cakes to cool for a short while.
Spoon and spread the marshmallow filling mixture onto the one side of the Devil Dog bun.
Press another Devil Dog bun slightly on top of the filling side of the other bun.
Put the finishing touches on the cake bars and get ready to eat them.

text: Preheat an oven to 400 °F (204 °C).  Place the eggs needed into a medium-sized bowl along with the shortening and sugar.  Beat this mixture with a blender.  Combine into this mixture the milk and vanilla needed, but don't stop blending while doing so.  Combine in another bowl the flour, cocoa, salt and baking powder.  Mix the two bowls together.  Blend this mixture until smooth and creamy.  Spoon about 1 Tbsp. of batter into strips measuring approximately 4 inches (10.2 cm) long by 1 inch (2.5 cm) wide onto a cookie sheet. The original recipe states to use a lightly greased cookie sheet, however, you may find it producing better results if you use a sheet of waxed/parchment paper instead (to enrich the color), but be sure to adjust the cook times to compensate for this change. Bake these strips for 5-6 minutes or until they are done. Prepare the filling as these strips are baking. Combine all ingredients used to prepare the filling in another bowl. This includes the marshmallow cream filling, shortening, sugar, vanilla, salt and water. Take out your Devil Dog "buns"/"Cakes" from the oven.  Allow these cakes to cool for a short while.  Spoon and spread the marshmallow filling mixture onto the one side of the Devil Dog bun.  Press another Devil Dog bun slightly on top of the filling side of the other bun.  Put the finishing touches on the cake bars and get ready to eat them.
